Class Enemy

  • java.lang.Object
    • RenderableObject
      • Racer
        • Enemy
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    GlobalHelper
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Dog, Elephant, Octopus

    public abstract class Enemy
extends Racer

    Enemy

    Abstract class from which specific Enemy subclasses can be created and instantiated

    This abstract class defines standard methods that will be inherited by the different subtypes of Enemy, namely Octopus, Dog and Elephant. Additionally, there are static methods which can be called from World in order to handle all the Enemies collectively, including update and render methods. Constructors and non-static methods appear first, followed by the static methods.
    Author:
    Daniel Porteous porteousd 696965

    • Constructor Detail

      • Enemy

        public Enemy(int startX,
             int startY)
      throws org.newdawn.slick.SlickException
        Calls the standard constructor from the superclass Racer, which in turn calls the super constructor of RenderableObject which does most of the heavy lifting. The only additional step is to set our targets on the first (well, 0th) waypoint.
        Parameters:
        startX - In pixels. Horizontal x-coordinate starting position.
        startY - In pixels. Vertical y-coordinate starting position.
        Throws:
        org.newdawn.slick.SlickException - Standard error thrown by slick, handled with this throws clause.

    • Method Detail

      • determineBehaviour

        public abstract void determineBehaviour(double[][] waypoints,
                                        Player player)
        As is the trade off with abstract methods, not every subclass of Enemy will need the player to be passed to them. However this is a necessary sacrifice for the conciseness and extensibility offered by being able to call all the subclass methods in a simple for loop in an abstract superclass such as we do here with the method updateEnemies(). This method will vary based on the subclass, and for some (such as Elephant), will be nothing but a call to the followWaypoints() method.
        Parameters:
        waypoints - The waypoints that the Enemy will follow. These are normally held in world as they're intrinsic to the map.
        player - The player object, necessary specifically for the individual behaviour of Dog and Octopus.

      • checkItemCollision

        public void checkItemCollision(java.util.ArrayList<Item> mapItems)
        Goes through each item on the map and confirms that it is active. This active check is necessary because only the player can interact with inactive items. This is also the reason why this method can't be moved up into the Racer class, as the behaviour is different for Player and Enemy. If the item is confirmed as active, it checks if the Enemy is within the set range of them. If so, it removes the item from the map and adds it to that Enemy's active effects, which will be cycled through in the processActiveItems() method of Racer.
        Specified by:
        checkItemCollision in class Racer
        Parameters:
        mapItems - An ArrayList of all the items currently on the map, both dormant and active

      • followWaypoints

        public void followWaypoints(double[][] waypoints)
        Called each turn, this method checks whether the Enemy has come within the range of its target waypoint. If this is the case it will increase the waypoint tracker and next iteration will start to move towards the next one. If it gets to the last waypoint it will cease advancing.
        Parameters:
        waypoints - An array of arrays, specifically 2 item arrays holding an x and y coordinate, specifying the waypoints to which the Enemy should go, in order of travel.

      • getCorrectRotateDir

        public double getCorrectRotateDir(double targetX,
                                  double targetY)
        Calculates the new direction to which the kart should rotate in order to move towards the new target. This involves first finding out first whether the angle of the kart is more or less than that created between the kart's current position and its target. Following that, the quadrant that the kart is in (consider a unit circle) is calculated using atan and the rotate direction is returned accordingly.
        Parameters:
        targetX - x-coordinate in pixels of the target waypoint.
        targetY - y-coordinate in pixels of the target waypoint.
        Returns:
        Returns a double indicating which direction the Kart should rotate.

      • createEnemies

        public static Enemy[] createEnemies()
                             throws org.newdawn.slick.SlickException
        Instantiates objects for each Enemy to exist in the game. Notably, unlike for the Items or the Waypoints, the Enemies aren't read in from a file but are instead hardcoded in. This is more acceptable however because there are only 3 enemies, and little room in the current map for more.
        Returns:
        A static array containing all the Enemies.
        Throws:
        org.newdawn.slick.SlickException

      • updateEnemies

        public static void updateEnemies(World world,
                                 Racer[] racers,
                                 Enemy[] enemies,
                                 Player player,
                                 java.util.ArrayList<Item> mapItems,
                                 double[][] waypoints)
                          throws org.newdawn.slick.SlickException
        This method is a gateway to the methods that do most of the heavy lifting with the implementation of all the Enemies. As far as this method goes however, all we do is call the generic Racer level update for each Enemy, followed by the determineBehaviour() method, which enacts the specific behaviour of the individual subclasses of Enemy.
        Parameters:
        enemies - Array of all the enemies currently active on the map.
        world - The world object itself, passed in so we can calculate frictions.
        mapItems - List of all the items on the map, whether active or not.
        racers - Array of the Racers. This may seem a bit counter intuitive, passing Racers, Enemies and Player through individually considering that Enemies and Player are just subsets of the Racer array. However, at some stage these subsets need to be calculated, and considering this has already been done in World we may as well just pass them in instead of recalculating them.
        waypoints - An array of 2 item arrays containing the waypoints as doubles.
        player - The player object. This is used in to determine the specific behaviour of Dog and Octopus.
        Throws:
        org.newdawn.slick.SlickException

      • renderEnemies

        public static void renderEnemies(Enemy[] enemies,
                                 double camX,
                                 double camY)
        Takes the list of enemies and calls their render methods one by one, pretty simple.
        Parameters:
        enemies - A list of the enemies on the map.
        camX - The current x-coordinate of the camera.
        camY - The current y-coordinate of the camera.
